keyPoints.title: All in all, about 15 quintillion complement proteins are saturating every fluid in your body right now.

content.data: A healthy adult has about 5.3 micro molar of C3 in their blood. For this calculation, well round it to 5.
One micro molar equals 6.022 x 10^17 molecules in a liter.
An average adult contains roughly 5 liters of blood.
So 6 x 10^17 x 5 x 5 = 1.5x 10 ^19, or 15 quintillion.
